Name: Morning Star IV
Description: Now the storm has passed, let us celebrate again.
QuestDesc: Now the storm has passed, let us celebrate again.

Conditions.PreQuestName: Morning Star: Those Who Remain in the Night Part II

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're over there, {PlayerName}. Let's go join them!

Dialogues.Speaker: Drunken Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cheers! Hurrah! Woohoo!

Dialogues.Speaker: Gentle Woman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aren't you extra jovial today! Even more so than during the Carnevale!

Dialogues.Speaker: Drunken Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's because I tidied up this floor we're standing on myself. Hung those lights and balloons. Even these cups? Scavenged them from the ruins!

Dialogues.Speaker: Drunken Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How should I put it? It's giving me this magical rush, like I'm saving the world. Haha!

Dialogues.Speaker: Gentle Woman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, indeed. Sparkling floors, cheerful lights, and the sound of your laughter. I truly feel salvation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gentle Woman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But still, go easy on yourself, okay? Don't get too carried away, "great hero"!

Dialogues.Speaker: Timid Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: O Sentinel, do you see it? Your small, brave children still stand. We will continue to live on, as always.

Dialogues.Speaker: Loud Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, Acolyte over there. Who are you mumbling to?

Dialogues.Speaker: Timid Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah! I... Well... to... to our great Sentinel...

Dialogues.Speaker: Loud Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That tiny voice? You think the Sentinel could hear that squeak? If you want to be heard, you've got to shout with your whole heart. Loud enough for all of Septimont to hear!

Dialogues.Speaker: Loud Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Like this!

Dialogues.Speaker: Loud Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: O—Great Sentinel! Listen to this! The Threnodian couldn't break us. We're alive, see?! We're strong today, and we'll be strong tomorrow! Just watch—Just watch and see!!!

Dialogues.Speaker: Loud Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There. Now the Sentinel just might've heard you a little better.

Dialogues.Speaker: Timid Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you…

Dialogues.Speaker: Loud Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't mention it!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's the performance for today?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Today? No performance today. I want to stay in the crowd a bit longer, hehe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I was young, my great-grandmother used to tell me about how we Ragunnesi used to celebrate the Carnevale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They'd lay out wooden planks over the water, building a stage for anyone brave enough to leap up and perform. And at the end, everyone would receive the Laurel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, that is how it should be, just like now!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, I heard that after receiving supplies from the Troupe, the small square in the Old District is almost restored.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everyone is preparing a little celebration on the completion day. We should go see it together!
